questions.question: What is the probability of getting a head when a fair coin is tossed?
A bag contains 3 red and 2 green balls. What is the probability of picking a red ball?
If a coin is tossed 100 times and lands on heads 45 times, what is the experimental probability of getting heads?
In 50 trials, a spinner lands on blue 20 times. What is the experimental probability of landing on blue?
What is the theoretical probability of rolling a 4 on a fair six-sided die?
A standard deck has 52 cards. What is the probability of drawing an ace?
If the probability of raining tomorrow is 0.3, what is the probability that it will not rain?
The probability of a student passing an exam is 0.8. What is the probability of failing?
What is the probability of getting two heads when two fair coins are tossed?
What is the probability of rolling a 2 and a 5 in two dice rolls?
How many outcomes are there when flipping a coin and rolling a die?
Using a tree diagram, how many outcomes are there in tossing two coins?
Which pair of events are mutually exclusive?

options.A: Being a cat and a dog at the same time
options.C: Getting a head and a tail in one coin toss
options.D: Rolling a 2 and a 3 on one die

questions.question: If events A and B are mutually exclusive, what is P(A or B)?

options.A: P(A) + P(B)

questions.question: If two events A and B are independent, what is P(A and B)?

options.A: P(A) / P(B)

questions.question: Which of these are independent events?

options.A: Choosing a ball and not putting it back
options.B: Rolling a die and flipping a coin
options.C: Drawing two cards from a deck without replacement
